update.title: Add log playback mode

content.raw: Pressing step forward should pause the playback so that's expected behavior. The problem with stepping forward, or gzweb log playback in general, is that log filtering is still enabled in the bridge so the model poses get filtered when stepping through the simulation. I've ticketed issue #116 to capture this.
content.html: Pressing step forward should pause the playback so that's expected behavior. The problem with stepping forward, or gzweb log playback in general, is that log filtering is still enabled in the bridge so the model poses get filtered when stepping through the simulation. I've ticketed issue #116 to capture this.

content.raw:
I've a problem with the step forward button
The step only works when the log is being played, and just once then it is paused, and it doesn't work after that, until its played again.
content.html: I've a problem with the step forward button The step only works when the log is being played, and just once then it is paused, and it doesn't work after that, until its played again.

content.raw:
Well I had a feeling that I was missing something, thanks.
I'll test it with the proper sequence then.
content.html: Well I had a feeling that I was missing something, thanks. I'll test it with the proper sequence then.

content.raw:
Just checking, can you playback the log properly with gzclient? The steps I did to test this pull request were:

1. Open normal Gazebo, insert a double pendulum
1. Record a short log file (through the GUI)
1. Close Gazebo
1. Start gzserver playing back the log file you just recorded, and paused, something like `gzserver -u -p ~/.gazebo/logs/...`
1. Start gzweb
1. Start gzclient

Both gzclient and gzweb should look different from the usual simulation mode, there's now the slider and other buttons.
content.html:
Just checking, can you playback the log properly with gzclient? The steps I did to test this pull request were:

  1. Open normal Gazebo, insert a double pendulum
  2. Record a short log file (through the GUI)
  3. Close Gazebo
  4. Start gzserver playing back the log file you just recorded, and paused, something like gzserver -u -p ~/.gazebo/logs/...
  5. Start gzweb
  6. Start gzclient

Both gzclient and gzweb should look different from the usual simulation mode, there's now the slider and other buttons.

content.raw:
not sure how to reproduce the issue, but the playback slider doesn't appear in both chrome and firefox, no errors appear, and checked with inspect its html code is there.

Chrome:
It is worth noting that on this branch and on default I'm getting ```getDescendants ``` is not a function, and I cant spawn any model.

Firefox: 
the ``` getDescendants ``` doesn't appear and things work normally, but still no logplay appears.

Update: I had to remove ``` display: none``` in the logplay div tag ``` <div id="logplay" ``` for the box to appear .
content.html:
not sure how to reproduce the issue, but the playback slider doesn't appear in both chrome and firefox, no errors appear, and checked with inspect its html code is there.

Chrome: It is worth noting that on this branch and on default I'm getting getDescendants is not a function, and I cant spawn any model.

Firefox: the getDescendants doesn't appear and things work normally, but still no logplay appears.

Update: I had to remove display: none in the logplay div tag <div id="logplay" for the box to appear .

content.raw:
The time display is a bit too tight on Firefox, we could make it fit better. I also ticketed issue #100 for the time on play mode. I haven't looked at this code in a long time, but I remember there was a trick somewhere to force the font to be the same size on all browsers. Not a blocker now, we can fix this in the future.

![timelog.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/r77Gja/images/3211173545-timelog.png)
content.html: The time display is a bit too tight on Firefox, we could make it fit better. I also ticketed issue #100 for the time on play mode. I haven't looked at this code in a long time, but I remember there was a trick somewhere to force the font to be the same size on all browsers. Not a blocker now, we can fix this in the future.
